etymology.description: 埶(埶) (yì, "art") + 灬(灬) (fire radical) = artfully controlled fire -> heat -> semiotic phonetic 执(埶)
etymology.interpretation: The character 熱 (rè) in its traditional form combines 埶(埶) (yì, "art") which phonetically hints at the pronunciation and 灬(灬) indicating fire, to designate an artfully controlled fire representing heat. The fire radical emphasizes the concept of heat and heat generation.
etymology.simplification: Simplified by replacing 埶(埶) with 执(埶) (zhí, "to hold") for phonetic reduction and easier writing.

examples.chinese: 他发热(他發熱)，需要去医院(需要去醫院)。
examples.pinyin: Tā fā rè, xūyào qù yīyuàn.
examples.english: He has a fever and needs to go to the hospital.

examples.chinese: 夏天特别热(夏天特別熱)，游泳是消暑之良方(游泳是消暑之良方)。
examples.pinyin: Xiàtiān tèbié rè, yóuyǒng shì xiāoshǔ zhī liángfāng.
examples.english: Summer is especially hot, and swimming is an excellent way to cool off.
